utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: So, there will be time to hit the beach while we’re in LA, right?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re here to learn about my missing time, not work on your tan.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, give me a little credit, Dad. I’m not that shallow. We were hoping to scope out some quality man candy.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY SHIPTON
utterance.content: Mmm. Surfers are hot.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You are a bad influence.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s not a compli-

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Never mind. Look, Koreatown’s about twenty minutes away. The restaurant I was in is not going to be open for another few hours, giving us plenty of time to settle in. Hi, Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Later?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Reservation for –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hmm. Not too shabby.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Glad you like it ‘cause this is going to be home base. And you are going to be running it while Hayley and I hit the streets.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Wait, that’s not fair.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Too bad. We don’t know what we’re going to find here. I was shot while I was missing. Remember, that could have happened in LA.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Your father’s right. Until we get more information we have to proceed with caution.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look on the bright side; there are worse places to be trapped than a five-star hotel with room service.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: BELLBOY
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, we’ve got your luggage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Great. Just uh, put it right in there for me.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hmm – – I’m good here.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Maybe I’ll wait with you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s this?

utterance.speaker: BELLBOY
utterance.content: Messenger dropped that off for you a few minutes ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Who’s it from?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not sure. “Mr. Castle, your services are required. A body has been found at the Hollywood Forever Cemetery. The LAPD needs your help.” And it’s signed “The G.D.S”.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Who’s G.D.S?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Greatest Detective Society.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s the Greatest Detective Society. It’s a legendary organization. Rumor has it Sir Arthur Conan Doyle was a secret member.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: And … it’s a myth. It’s a fairytale old PIs tell rookies to get them to do their scut work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Said the detective that didn’t get an invitation.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: All right, real or not, we’re here to investigate your missing time, Dad. Not a murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. But the restaurant doesn’t open for another couple of hours. Hollywood Forever Cemetery is on the way. Can’t hurt to take a look, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How’re we going to get in there? I’ve got it. You create a diversion –

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Uh, excuse me? Hello? Excuse me. Looking for Detective Menendez.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL FROST
utterance.content: He’s uh … with the M.E.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Thank you. Kurt? Hey.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE KURT MENENDEZ
utterance.content: Hayley. I did not know you were in town.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yeah. We just got in from New York. This is Richard Castle. Kurt Menendez, Major Crimes division.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Great to meet you.

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: Likewise. Doing a little grisly sightseeing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, no pleasure this time. Just business.

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: What kind of business?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, come on, Kurt. You know the drill. Client confidentiality and all that. But anything we find we’ll share with you.

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: I’ve heard that one before.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yes, but any failures on my part have always been remedied with the finest single malt. So what do you say? Let us in for a little look-see? Yes?

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: Sure. Come on.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: Our victim’s name is Phillip Harris. Local private investigator. M.E. said he was killed around midnight. Throat cut and then the killer took out his heart.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Done with surgical precision?

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: Not particularly.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: So, New York, huh?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yeah, just flew in this morning.

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: That’s funny, because our victim just flew back from New York yesterday morning. I left word for a sister who lives there.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Crazy coincidence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, I work very closely with the Twelfth Precinct in New York. Detectives Ryan and Esposito. They could talk to Harris’s sister for you, maybe run down any New York leads.

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: Okay, thanks. I’ll give them a call. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell them I said hi! They love me.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Castle? He’s a giant pain in the ass, but he’s good people. Okay, uh, yeah, sure. We’ll help. We’ll interview Harris’s sister, Veronica. Yeah, why don’t you send us a copy of the murder book? Okay. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: I need a favor. But you can’t tell Javi.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know if I’m comfortable with that.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s not bad. It’s just … I met a guy, I like him, and I want you to run a background check on him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Romantic.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Seriously. In this day and age you can’t trust anyone. I don’t want to fall for the guy and then discover he’s got a thing for putting the lotion in the basket.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll check it out.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Check what out?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, this uh… this uh … rash that I have. I want to get Lanie’s medical opinion on it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Too much information, bro.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s what I said. Later boys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: First thing we need to do is figure out what case Phillip Harris was working on. Odds are, that’s what got him killed.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I love a gruesome murder as much as the next girl, but we don’t have a client, and impressing that ridiculous detective society isn’t exactly on the top of my list.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it’s on mine. But first let’s see if anyone knows what I was doing here a year and a half ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, this is definitely the place.

utterance.speaker: HUNGRY ORCHARD OWNER
utterance.content: Here for lunch?

utterance.speaker: HUNGRY ORCHARD OWNER
utterance.content: - call the cops. … the watch.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Richard! What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were here eighteen months ago.

utterance.speaker: HUNGRY ORCHARD OWNER
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. It’s my place. What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Do you recognize him?

utterance.speaker: HUNGRY ORCHARD OWNER
utterance.content: No. Should I?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was here, about um … – I was here about a year and a half ago. Something happened. You yelled at me.

utterance.speaker: HUNGRY ORCHARD OWNER
utterance.content: Oh, you’re the guy with the watch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What watch?

utterance.speaker: HUNGRY ORCHARD OWNER
utterance.content: You – you couldn’t pay and then I was going to call the cops on you and then you – you gave me your watch to hold on to, said you were going to come back for it, but you never came.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was I with anybody?

utterance.speaker: HUNGRY ORCHARD OWNER
utterance.content: Uh, no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did I talk to anybody? Did I tell you where I’d been or where I was going?

utterance.speaker: HUNGRY ORCHARD OWNER
utterance.content: No, you uh … just ate and then you left. Um … you gave me your watch first.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you still have the watch?

utterance.speaker: HUNGRY ORCHARD OWNER
utterance.content: Best wingman I ever had.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It does not look familiar. And it’s a knockoff, but it’s the freshest clue we have. I’ll buy it back from you.

utterance.speaker: HUNGRY ORCHARD OWNER
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: VERONICA HARRIS
utterance.content: My brother was right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right about what?

utterance.speaker: VERONICA
utterance.content: The Phantom. A serial killer Phillip was hunting. He stumbled onto it working a missing persons case.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We haven’t heard of any active serials nicknamed The Phantom.

utterance.speaker: VERONICA
utterance.content: That’s why Phillip called him The Phantom. Because no one has any idea he exists. According to Phillip, The Phantom had been killing people in Los Angeles and New York for the last several years.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A bi-coastal serial killer?

utterance.speaker: VERONICA
utterance.content: Right before Phillip flew back to LA he told me he’d had a break in the case. That he was close to identifying The Phantom. He must have gotten too close to the truth.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I pulled autopsy reports on The Phantom’s alleged victims. A total of seven; four in LA, three in New York. All seven were killed with a knife.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Any pattern besides the knife?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No, the victims are all over the map. Four men, three women, different ethnicities and ages. Each of the victims had something removed. An ear, an eye, a finger.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why? What’s the significance of that?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: There is none. And because of the randomness no one was able to connect the murders. Until Phillip Harris, of course.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So Phillip was right. A serial killer’s been hunting in LA and New York for three years completely under the radar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All this way for a dead end.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Well, it might be for the best. Ignorance is bliss.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, ignorance is hell.

utterance.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
utterance.content: Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The G.D.S. is requesting my presence at headquarters. This must mean I passed their test and they want me to join their ranks.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I hate to burst your fanboy bubble, but how do you know this is on the up-and-up?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is this on the up-and-up?

utterance.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
utterance.content: Yes, sir.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Watching your back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh … we’ve a –

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: Mr. Castle. Miss Shipton. It’s a pleasure to meet both of you. I’m Mason Wood.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What a pleasure. I cannot even believe I’m here. This is a dream come true.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: That’s very kind of you to say. Our society has a long and rich history and our membership spans every continent, save Antarctica.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not too many murders there.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: No, no.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: Although I did find a lost Chinese treasure ship hidden in an iceberg in 2007. Now, I hate to do this, but I need to speak to Mr. Castle alone. I’m sure you understand, Miss Shipton.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No. I can … stay here if that’s what you mean.

utterance.speaker: MASONS WOOD
utterance.content: Excellent. This way.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Ooh.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: As you can see, we have assembled a few of our members.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi. Hi. Hi. Hi. Hi. I know you. Wait, you were at the crime scene. You’re a cop.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL FROST
utterance.content: No. But I wear the hell out of a uniform.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: This is Kendall Frost. She’s a private detective based out of San Francisco.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m afraid I’m a little confused. What exactly are we doing here?

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: Phillip Harris was a member of our society. His death is a tragedy, but it is also an opportunity for you or Miss Frost. Phillip’s death has left an opening in our ranks. Whichever one of you solves his murder will be invited in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Phillip Harris was right. There is a Phantom serial killer murdering people on both coasts.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: That’s clever. Splitting up his hunting ground kept people from knowing of his existence. Did the boys get any leads?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just one. The sister said that Phillip Harris was working undercover at Zenith Studios.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: They’re the ones that ruined the Nikki Heat movie franchise.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not ruined. Destroyed. Terminated. Extirpated. Vaporized. Eviscerated.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Do you plan on running through the full thesaurus?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I think that’ll about do it. Anyway, Phillip thought someone at Zenith Studios was the Phantom.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Makes sense. Plenty of people connected with the film industry are bi-coastal.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Directors, producers, cinematographers –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And actors, who are borderline sociopaths, by the way.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You don’t have to tell me. Hey, did anyone at Zenith know that Phillip was working there undercover?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just one. Head of the studio.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Let’s go talk to him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you. I am so going to get that spot in The Greatest Detective Society. I mean, there’s no way Kendall has access to the kind of details that I have.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, don’t get cocky, Rick. You haven’t solved the murder yet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hide me.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: What? How?

utterance.speaker: COURTNEY
utterance.content: Rick Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, hi, Courtney.

utterance.speaker: COURTNEY
utterance.content: Hi, I’m Courtney.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Hayley. So what’s going on? You guys have a beef or something?

utterance.speaker: COURTNEY
utterance.content: Me and Rick?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: COURTNEY
utterance.content: No. No way. Me and Rick are buds!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Buds? Last time I saw you you tried to run me down with a golf cart because I wouldn’t let you get cast in the Nikki Heat movie.

utterance.speaker: COURTNEY
utterance.content: But what I didn’t know then, which I do now, was that your movie was going to be quite possibly the worst movie ever made. Not being cast in your movie was the best thing that could have ever happened to my career. So thanks! Let’s do lunch sometime. Nice meeting you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Say hi to Brandon. Can you believe her? Worst movie ever made?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yeah, I can believe her. It was a terrible film.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that was all thanks to this really obtuse studio executive. What the hell was his name?

utterance.speaker: TREVOR NIGEL
utterance.content: Trevor Nigel. And you must be Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: TREVOR
utterance.content: We’ve only ever talked on the phone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Nice to finally put a face to all those notes. Thank you so much for seeing us without an appointment.

utterance.speaker: TREVOR
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? This is fate. I’m serious. Rick, you name literally just came up in our last story development meeting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It did?

utterance.speaker: TREVOR
utterance.content: No. Now, look. I know this studio did a poor job producing Heat Wave but believe me, I fought for your vision. And now that I am running the studio, it is time to get back in the Richard Castle business.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, well, thank you. I’m flattered. But we’re not actually here about my books. We’re actually looking into the murder of Phillip Harris.

utterance.speaker: TREVOR
utterance.content: Yes, I heard about that. It was shocking. Phil was a great guy. He saved my ass a couple of years ago. Got photos of my ex having an affair with her personal psychic.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: TREVOR
utterance.content: Saved me millions.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: So Phillip’s sister told us that you gave him permission to go undercover here at the studio.

utterance.speaker: TREVOR
utterance.content: Yes. Phil said he was working a case, he asked for a favor, I owed him one, so I said okay.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: And who was he investigating?

utterance.speaker: TREVOR
utterance.content: He wanted access to Austin Electra.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The movie director?

utterance.speaker: TREVOR
utterance.content: Yeah, shooting a film over on 1. Gladiators. It’s going to made a billion in China. Hold - hold on. You don’t think that Austin has something to do with Phil’s murder?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Was Austin filming last night?

utterance.speaker: TREVOR
utterance.content: He was supposed to. But for some reason he shut down production early and took off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: About what time did he leave the lot?

utterance.speaker: TREVOR
utterance.content: Right around 11 o’clock. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Giving him lots of time to get to that cemetery. Where do we find Stage 1?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You work out?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, look. There’s Austin. So, how do you want to play this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, if he did kill Phillip Harris he’s bound to be on guard, so we can’t let him know we are looking at him as a suspect. Kendall?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, she’s good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did she get onto Austin so quick? We’re done for. She’s already got him wrapped around her skinny little finger.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Don’t say I never did anything for you.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: There you are, darling.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: So … who’s our new friend?

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: Babe, this is Austin Electra.

utterance.speaker: AUSTIN ELECTRA
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: AUSTIN
utterance.content: So I just invited your girlfriend up to my place later –

utterance.speaker: ASSISTANT DIRECTOR
utterance.content: Ready to rehearse.

utterance.speaker: AUSTIN
utterance.content: You’re more than welcome to join if you want.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, that sounds naughty. I love naughty.

utterance.speaker: ASSISTANT DIRECTOR
utterance.content: Ready to rehearse.

utterance.speaker: AUSTIN
utterance.content: Gotta go. See you ladies tonight?

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: Are you kidding me with this?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, come on, sweetie. All’s fair in love and murder investigations.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: What, do you think this is a game?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As hot as it would be to see you two fight – especially after that kiss – we need to work together on this. It is in all our best interests.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: All right, we’ll work together. For now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. This is actually going to work out great. While you and Kendall keep Austin distracted I’ll search his house for proof that he’s the Phantom. Membership in the G.D.S. is as good as mine.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, yay for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s wrong? Was it the kiss with Kendall? Was it – too much tongue? Not enough tongue?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No – well, not enough. No, Kendall was right. This is not a game. If Austin Electra is in fact the Phantom then … we are walking right into the lair of a serial killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, repeat everything you said after “not enough”.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, God have mercy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, Kev.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey! Hey, hey, hey. What’s up, partner?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle and Hayley might be on to something. Turns out that movie director was in New York during two of the Phantom’s murders.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What about the third?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Based on financials there’s no indication where Austin was.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which means he could have been here committing that third New York homicide. This could be our guy.

utterance.speaker: ESPSOITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m going to keep digging. Oh, and uh … … what is this, bro?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What are you hiding from me? And who is Tyler Ross? And why are you running a background check on him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Tyler’s nobody. Um … well, you see, okay, Jenny and I, we’re looking to have a new nanny. Or in Tyler’s case, a manny.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Stop it. You’re like the worst liar ever. Who is this guy?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s Lanie’s new boyfriend. She wanted me to check him out but not to tell you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know what this means, right? We are going to have some fun. At Lanie’s expense.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Lanie? I got your text.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: And I’ve got your murder weapon. A picture of it, anyway. I used the autopsies of the Phantom’s victims to generate this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hmm. The serrations near the base are pretty distinctive.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Exactly. Find the knife –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Find the killer. Nice work.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: So how’s the background check going?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, pretty good so far.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I don’t like the sound of that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, there’s – there’s nothing to worry about. Yet. It’s just a rumor.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Let’s hear it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, he’s got a thing about clowns.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That’s okay. Lots of people are afraid of clowns.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, no, no. He’s not afraid of them. He likes them.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Like … a fetish? Oh, good Lord.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I – I haven’t verified it yet. I still have to speak with one of his exes.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Okay, keep me posted, will you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ryan, that is excellent. Thank you. Now, just hold off on giving it to the LAPD, just until morning. We have a plan to expose who’s behind this.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Or get ourselves killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Having second thoughts?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: About having a ménage with a trophy taking serial killer? No, what could possibly go wrong?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is the murder weapon. All you have to do is distract Austin long enough for me to find this knife.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Let’s just hope we don’t find it in one of our backs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, sorry! I was setting up a few counter surveillance precautions.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think we’re being bugged?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We aren’t sure exactly what or who we’re looking for out here, so I figured we can’t be sure who’s looking for us.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: So what tripped the alarm?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Maybe the sensor’s turned up too high.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Ah, ha ha ha.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'll be damned. Looks like this watch is good for something other than taking care of checks at Korean restaurants.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Hello. Someone has hardwired a GSP transmitter to the watch’s battery.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think it’s CIA? Left over from my Thailand mission?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: It’s possible. Doubt we’ll ever know for sure.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Can’t we track down where it was purchased?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No, I’m afraid this transmitter’s incredibly common, which makes tracking it almost impossible.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But we have to try, right? I mean, that’s why we’re here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kendall! Wow, you certainly have baited the hook.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: I had to, considering it’s going to be two against one tonight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: Come on, Rick. I know you’re going to sneak into Austin’s house to look for evidence while Hayley and I distract him. I’m no fool. But you are, if you think your little plan will work without these.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Schematics to Austin Electra’s house. Where’d you get those?

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: Don’t worry your pretty little head about that.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Pretty.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: While Hayley and I distract Austin you need to look for this. It’s a false wall.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A secret room? That would be the perfect place for Austin to hide the grisly trophies he takes from his victims.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: Exactly. Now, if you find evidence that Austin is the killer I get equal credit. No double-crosses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Deal. That way Mason Wood has to make both of us members of the Society. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: Hold on. Is that what you’re wearing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No. Deciding between something I brought and something Rick’s about to buy me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I know the direction you’ll be leaning in.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh … you really do deserve to be in the Greatest Detective Society.

utterance.speaker: AUSTIN
utterance.content: Wow. Come in, come in. Let’s get some drinks in you.

utterance.speaker: AUSTIN
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: AUSTIN
utterance.content: A little something to loosen your inhibitions.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Don’t worry, we’re plenty loose already.

utterance.speaker: AUSTIN
utterance.content: Not after I’ve tied you up.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: AUSTIN
utterance.content: So … who’s first?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Uh …

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Um … tell you what? Uh … why don’t you let me tie you up first?

utterance.speaker: AUSTIN
utterance.content: And how am I going to do all the terrible things I’ve got planned for you?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sure you’ll figure something out. Isn’t that right, Kendall? Ken – Kendall? Damn it – – she’s going to miss all the fun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’ve been had. That dirty little –

utterance.speaker: AUSTIN
utterance.content: I’m getting tired of chasing you.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: There are gains to taking a short break.

utterance.speaker: AUSTIN
utterance.content: What the hell? Hey, where’s your friend? Huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thought we had a deal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No more double crosses.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: Sorry, Ricky. But I am going to be the one to take those trophies in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, good luck with that. Because I’m looking for a murder weapon. Serrated blade, but I guess you wouldn’t know that.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: You’re lying.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. And here it is.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: Okay, great. We’ll take it in together.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: Like you said, we have a deal, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, so now the deal’s back on?

utterance.speaker: AUSTIN
utterance.content: Drop the knife!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Austin. The police know we’re here. If you kill us they will catch you.

utterance.speaker: AUSTIN
utterance.content: I’m not going to kill you.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: Then why are you holding us at gunpoint?

utterance.speaker: AUSTIN
utterance.content: Because you’re robbing me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re not robbing you. We’re getting evidence that you’re a serial killer. Like this knife, which has been used in seven ritualistic murders.

utterance.speaker: AUSTIN
utterance.content: What are you talking about? I’m not a serial killer. I’m a film director and that is a prop from a horror movie I shot two years ago.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Well, prop or not, this knife matches our victims’ wounds exactly.

utterance.speaker: AUSTIN
utterance.content: There were five identical knives made for that film, which means there are four others out there just like it. Maybe you should be looking for one of those.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you were in New York for three of those murders.

utterance.speaker: AUSTIN
utterance.content: So were eight million other people, including my assistant who can prove my whereabouts at all times. Now, get the hell out of my house!

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Do you think you could –

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, the director was telling the truth. His alibis check out for all three New York murders.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Then we need to track down all the knives that were made for that horror movie.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, clearly one of them was used to commit all seven murders.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: There were eight.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What – what are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I discovered a fourth New York victim, a man by the name of Pat Crews.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Are you sure? Phillip Harris only knew about three.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: There’s a reason he missed this one. Because this murder took place on the same day the Phantom killed a woman in Los Angeles.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How can that be? Unless –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: There are two serial killers. One on each coast.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, who is that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. Whoever it is, I hope they’ve brought coffee. Detective Menendez!

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: You know –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Please come in.

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: - I expect to be screwed over by an asshat I don’t know. But not from one who’s supposed to be my friend.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I take it you heard about what happened at Austin Electra’s house last night.

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: You said you’d keep me in the loop.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Look, we can explain –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um, Austin has a prop knife that matched the murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: And our lab tested it this morning. It’s clean.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Did you manage to track down the other four knives used in the movie?

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: Two of the knives are still at the studio warehouse. They came up clean, too. And according to the prop master – who alibied out, by the way – the last two knives went missing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, Lanie discovered that there are two different murderers operating on either coast using identical weapons. All we have to do –

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: Oh, whoa, whoa. No, no, no. See, there is no we. You two are done. And if I catch either of you working this case I’ll have you both arrested for obstruction.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No, no, no! Oh …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Maybe a little single malt scotch will smooth things over?

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: Go home.

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: BELLBOY
utterance.content: This just came for you, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Um … – thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like Menendez isn’t the only one unhappy about last night. Mason wants to see Kendall and me right away.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Good luck.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This – – is payback.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: Thanks for coming in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’s everyone else?

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: Their enthusiasm for both of you waned after the way you conducted yourselves last night. It was messy, boorish, lacking the sophistication we expect from any potential member.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: It was his fault.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was her fault.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: No. It was my fault for thinking that either of you could ever have filled Phillip’s shoes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mr. Wood, please. Give me another chance.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: No, give me another chance. I will find Phillip’s killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She won’t. She’s been two steps behind me this whole time.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: Behind you? I got to Austin first.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I got to the knife. And although it wasn’t the actual murder weapon – thank you to my contacts at the NYPD – I have the address to the prop master’s cousin in San Pedro who kept two of the last prop knives for himself as souvenirs. You see, I am close.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: Okay. And may the best detective win.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: Don’t worry. I will.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: You realize she picked your pocket.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh yes.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: Whose address is on that piece of paper?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s the casting director my mother wanted to have a meeting with.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: Mm. Kendall is going to be mad when she finds out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like I’m scared of her.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: She is the master of krav maga. And she is deadly with a sniper rifle from a mile and a half.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: Good luck.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I could not sleep last night. I kept having nightmares that I was sleeping with Bozo the Clown. Please tell me you found out more.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, relax. I spoke with Tyler’s ex. He does not have a clown fetish.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But …

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: But what? But what, Ryan? You better speak up now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: His ex mentioned that he might have a bit of a bad habit.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: What kind of habit?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The kind that requires rubber sheets?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He’s a bed wetter?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Detective Menendez just called. According to the prop master, those two knives went missing on the last day of the shoot.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s got the studio pulling drive-on logs from that day. He’s going to send us over a copy so we can see if any of the names connect to one of the New York murders.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey! You okay?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Damn. What’d you tell her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Bed wetter.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: This had better be important. The masseuse was in the middle of doing things one only dreams of.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I was able to trace the tracker in my dad’s watch. It was purchased by a man named Malcolm McCabe.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Hmm. Born and raised in LA, former Army Special Forces. Says here he’s working overseas.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He has an aunt that’s living in Pasadena. We should go talk to her. See if she knows anything.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Sure, we could do that. Or we could just pretend you never found this.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Fine, but my Dad wants to know what happened during his missing time.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Of course he does. But what happens when your father starts poking his nose into this Malcolm fellow? Hmm? I mean, the guy is former Special Forces. God only knows what he’s doing for a living right now. Isn’t it safer for your father to maybe not remember what happened? You should delete this.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, I’m fine. Why don’t you head back to the spa?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Don’t have to tell me twice.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Check this out. I compared the drive-on list from the studio to the people connected to the fourth New York victim, Pat Crews.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Any matches?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Crews was a writing teacher at the news school. One of this early students is a successful screenwriter named Jordan Keegan, who now lives in New York but happened to be on the studio lot in LA when the murder weapons went missing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let’s pick his ass up.

utterance.speaker: DOROTHY MCCABE
utterance.content: So you’re doing an news story on my nephew Malcolm?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh huh. It’s about war heroes.

utterance.speaker: DOROTHY
utterance.content: Oh, look. Isn’t he handsome?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: DOROTHY
utterance.content: But like I said, he’s out of the country. His job keeps him really busy. Let me get you his number, okay?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: DOROTHY
utterance.content: I’ll be right back.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh, Ms. McCabe? I have to go. Thank you for your time.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Damn it, Alexis. You’re just like your old man. You can’t leave things alone.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Are you going to kill me?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: What? Why would you say that?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. Maybe because you’re connected to my Dad’s missing time and now you’re hiding in the back of my rental car.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Alexis, I would never hurt you. This is not what you think.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What the hell is your game, Hayley?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Believe me, you don’t want to know. Neither does your father.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: It’s complicated.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Jordan Keegan? We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: JORDAN KEEGAN
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, your name came up in a homicide. This is the murder weapon. It’s a prop from a movie that you wrote.

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So did you happen to keep one as a souvenir?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Perhaps two. One for yourself, one for your partner out in Los Angeles.

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: What are you guys talking about?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re talking about Pat Crews, your old writing teacher.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He was killed with a knife shaped exactly like that one.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Help me!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let her go, Jordan!

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: Stay back!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’ve got nowhere to go. Drop the scissors.

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: Listen, fellas, I’m a writer, so trust me when I say if the villain surrenders it’s just so unsatisfying. That’s why they always go out in style.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just relax, Jordan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Don’t do anything stupid.

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: Stupid? Me? How can you say that when we’ve outsmarted you for years?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who’s we? Who’s your partner in LA?

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: A genius. He believed in me. Took my visions, made them real.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Give us a name, Jordan.

utterance.speaker: JORDAN
utterance.content: You’ll never find him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, no. I understand. Thank you. Hey, that was Ryan and Esposito. They had to kill Jordan Keegan. But they sent us digital copies of Jordan’s computer. Now, I think we – and by we I mean the two of you – might be able to find something on there to give us a lead to find his west coast counterpart.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Rick. We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’ll give you two the room.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Do you remember when we first met?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How could I forget? You sucker punched me in the face.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No. No, we’d met before that. A year and a half earlier, to be precise.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mean this whole time you knew? Who the hell are you?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I’m Hayley. I didn’t lie about that. Technically I didn’t lie about anything. I – misrepresented, sure, but I didn’t lie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But why?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Because a year and a half ago you asked me to. In fact, you begged.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Ages ago I did some freelance work for MI-6. And I met some American spy on an op, an older gentleman, very handsome, smart as a whip.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My father.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Jackson Hunt. A year and half ago he calls me, asks me to keep an eye out on you here in LA. Said you were sticking your nose where it didn’t belong.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did he say I was doing?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I didn’t ask. He didn’t say. But I do know that after your two weeks in Thailand your undercover mission for the CIA was over and you were supposed to go home. But instead you went rogue and you came to LA. To keep tabs on you I borrowed a GPS tracker from a friend of mine, Malcolm, and I placed it in your –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - in my watch. That was you.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yeah, only you left it in that Korean restaurant. So I lost track of you. And by the time I found you, you’d been shot in the side.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who shot me?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You wouldn’t say. You did mention your CIA handler. A guy named Jenkins. And you said that you were going to go and ask him to erase everything that had happened to you here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But that doesn’t sound like me. I’m curious by nature. Why would I do that?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I have no clue. But you were adamant. And you made me promise that if – if I ever met you again I’d never say any of this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, that doesn’t explain why you stuck around, why you agreed to come work with me.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I’m fond of you, Rick. And I adore your daughter. And after a lifetime of caring about nobody but myself I decided to stick around and keep an eye on you two.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s like a Phillip K. Dick novel. I wish I could go back in time, tell myself not to erase my memory.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Or you could trust that you did it with good reason. Maybe just let your lost time go. If you keep looking, if you keep searching for that answer, well, there’s no telling what kind of hell you’ll unleash.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad? What did Hayley tell you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The truth.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Why did Hayley lie to us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because I asked her to. It’s complicated.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Can you trust her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Absolutely. And you can, too.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But you can’t trust me with the truth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. Hang on, Alexis, that’s not about trust. I am your father. And from the day you came into this world it’s been my job to protect you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So what’s our next move.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There is no next move. We let sleeping dogs lie. It’s safe that way. For everyone.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I’m really sorry to interrupt, but I think I found something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: On Phillip’s homicide?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yeah. I was going through Jordan Keegan’s computer files and I found something interesting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a screenplay.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Gemini Killers.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s a dreadful story about a serial killing duo. I’m not sure, but it might give us some insight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve seen this before.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: The script?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, the – the notes in the margins here. This odd handwriting – – I know who the killer is.

utterance.speaker: TREVOR
utterance.content: No, I cannot hold. I – it’s Trevor Nigel.

utterance.speaker: TREVOR
utterance.content: You’re going to have to move that.

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: Trevor Nigel, you’re under arrest.

utterance.speaker: TREVOR
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: We found the knife that killed Phillip Harris.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Along with a rather ghastly collection of human body parts.

utterance.speaker: TREVOR
utterance.content: I admit nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Neither did your partner before he was killed.

utterance.speaker: TREVOR
utterance.content: Jordan is dead? He gave me up, didn’t he? I knew I should never have partnered with a screenwriter.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, Trevor, you gave yourself up. Back when your studio was doing Heat Wave I gave you notes on that horrible script you commissioned. You sent it back to me with a handwritten note detailing why my ideas were stupid. I never forget a bad review, especially one with such distinctive handwriting.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: It’s the same handwriting on your serial killer partner’s screenplay.

utterance.speaker: TREVOR
utterance.content: Richard, you’re a pretty good writer. You really should read Jordan’s work because it is inspiring. After I read his Gemini Killers screenplay, I knew that I had found a kindred spirit, someone with the same desires as I had. And his script laid out the perfect plan for us to kill – – ow – without attracting suspicion. Sadly he could never nail the end.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, we did. And you’ve reached it.

utterance.speaker: TREVOR
utterance.content: Maybe you should do the rewrite. Call my assistant to set up a meeting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I’m good. Besides, I think your next picture is going to be a prison drama.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Hey. Still pissed at me?

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Come on! I’ll make it up to you the next time I’m in town.

utterance.speaker: MENENDEZ
utterance.content: You better.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was really cute.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, stop it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kendall. Hah … nice to see you. How was San Pedro? There wasn’t too much traffic, was there? What freeway did you take?

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: Well played, Castle. You beat me. Unfair and square.

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: Okay. Let’s get this over with.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where is she? Her text said it was important.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let’s go, then.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey, hey!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’d you do that for?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I confronted Tyler about his bed wetting.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey! Look, we’re sorry, okay?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s far from okay. We broke up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, we’ll talk to him. We’ll work it out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No, I broke up with him. After he denied being a bed wetter he admitted to having a fetish for – – ooh, let’s just say it was nasty.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What do you mean, nasty?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, what kind of nasty things is this dude into?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Get out of my morgue! Losers!

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: The competition has ended. Richard Castle, you have solved the murder of Phillip Harris.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you. Thank you very much. You’re too kind.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: You have proven yourself worthy and we, the members of The Greatest Detective Society, offer you a place at our table.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m humbled and flattered. But I’m afraid I must decline.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: KENDALL
utterance.content: What are you doing? This is a once in a lifetime opportunity to work with the best of the best.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not for me. I already work with the greatest detective in the world and I cannot wait to get back home to her. But sir, you should seriously consider Kendall for membership. She’s one hell of a detective and sneaky in all the right ways.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: You’re sure about this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Absolutely, sir.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: You just keep getting more and more interesting, Mr. Castle. I’m going to have to keep an eye on you.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Okay. Are you not packed?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t do it.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Pack your clothes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Walk away. Hayley, I need to know what happened to me.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Okay. There’s one last thing. Just before you left to get your memories erased you came to me with one final request.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like what kind of request?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: That if you demanded to know the truth to show you this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is this?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: it’s a secret website on the dark web.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s on it?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Not a clue. You installed a password that only you would know. Called it Blair’s combination.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s from a short story I wrote when I was seventeen that never saw the light of day. What was that combination? Four left, seventeen right, twenty one left.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I’ll step out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no. You’ve um, you’ve earned the right to see this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey there, buddy. It’s me. And by me, I mean you. And if you’re seeing this then you are an idiot because you are trying to figure out what happened to you in Los Angeles. What you discovered about Bracken’s partnership with LokSat, it’s too dangerous to pursue.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: LokSat? I knew about LokSat?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am barely living proof. I was shot trying to figure out where LokSat’s plane was landing tonight. I barely escaped without being identified. I am erasing our mind for a reason. To protect Kate. Because if she found out then she will die. So … do not tell her what you discovered in Los Angeles. For her sake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you know what this means?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yes. You tracked LokSat. If we can cross reference airports and identify what airplane landed the night you were shot then we have a real chance of finding out who LokSat really is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No. It means what happened was my fault. The murders of Beckett’s former AG team. In trying to protect Beckett from LokSat I inadvertently sent them all to death.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
